result.title: Mentors Weekly Contest #1 Editorial
result.content:
This and all the next contests Editorials will be placed in the form of hints of course if you have any troubles solving the problems feel free to ask.

Contest #1 Hints:

A — Count Palindromes:

Admin #1's Hint : الاهتمام مبيتطلبش، منتا لو مهتم كنت افتكرت لوحدك.

Admin #2's Hint : why not just convert the two times given to seconds then try everything that would be reasonable.

B — Renzo and the palindromic decoration :

Admin #1's Hint : trust the statement.

Admin #2's Hint : trust the statement برضوا.

C — Many questions :

Admin #1's Hint : really trust the statement.

Admin #2's Hint : no comment :).

D — Epic Fail of a Genie :

Admin #1's Hint : some negative number may give a larger answer.

Admin #2's Hint : a number like 2.5 can be represented in doubles 2.50000000001 so 2 of this numbers addition would be more than 5 when checking using an if condition can you find a way to fix this.

E — 1D Cafeteria (B) :

Admin #1's Hint : having all sizes available can we find if one fits the current family, remove it or add it faster?.

Admin #2's Hint : can we speed up the naive solution by using a data structure to save and delete fast ?.

F — Pairs :

Admin #1's Hint : a multiplicative inverse .. a modular .. :O modular multiplicative inverse.

Admin #2's Hint : modular multiplicative inverse برضوا.

G — Little thief of Shi :

Admin #1's Hint : a thieve with a bag sometimes called a knapsack*.

Admin #2's Hint : if we use a normal backtrack to solve can we convert this backtrack to DP and find what is the state at which the thieve knows what to do if he had already been there once.
